Home / Interviews / Interviews by Conference / SCNA 2012

SCNA 2012

SCNA 2012 brings together 23 interviews from 2012. Recurring themes include community building and user-group organizing, conference speaking and presentation skills, and developer education and learning. Featured interviewees include Gary Bernhardt, Adewale Oshineye, Adewale Oshinye, and Brad Wilkening.

  • Coverage: 23 interviews from 2012.
  • Featured interviewees: Gary Bernhardt, Adewale Oshineye, Adewale Oshinye, Brad Wilkening, and Brian Marick.
  • Common themes: community building and user-group organizing, conference speaking and presentation skills, developer education and learning, Ruby and Rails practice, and software craftsmanship and practice.

Trusted Sources

  • https://web.archive.org/web/20121123031707/http://scna.softwarecraftsmanship.org/

Notable Contributors

  • Gary Bernhardt — Creator of Destroy All Software. Focus: Software design clarity, developer tooling, and code quality discipline. Interview
  • Sandro Mancuso — Co-founder of the London Software Craftsmanship community. Focus: Software craftsmanship practice, mentoring, and engineering standards. Interview
  • Robert Martin — Agile Manifesto signatory; co-author of the Software Craftsmanship Manifesto; Clean Code author. Focus: Software craftsmanship, engineering professionalism, and sustainable delivery practices. Interview
  • Brian Marick Interview
